verses.verse: ( Paul Ministers in Corinth) ( ( 530 1:1-3 ; 540 1:1-2 )) Μετὰ <WG3326> Meta After ταῦτα <WG3778> tauta this , χωρισθεὶς <WG5563> chōristheis [Paul] left ἐκ <WG1537> ek . . . τῶν <WG3588> tōn - Ἀθηνῶν <WG116> Athēnōn Athens ἦλθεν <WG2064> ēlthen [and] went εἰς <WG1519> eis to Κόρινθον <WG2882> Korinthon Corinth .

καὶ <WG2532> kai [There] εὑρών <WG2147> heurōn he found τινα <WG5100> tina a Ἰουδαῖον <WG2453> Ioudaion Jew ὀνόματι <WG3686> onomati named Ἀκύλαν <WG207> Akylan Aquila Ποντικὸν <WG4193> Pontikon of Pontus , τῷ <WG3588> tō - , γένει <WG1085> genei a native προσφάτως <WG4373> prosphatōs who had recently ἐληλυθότα <WG2064> elēlythota come ἀπὸ <WG575> apo from τῆς <WG3588> tēs - Ἰταλίας <WG2482> Italias Italy καὶ <WG2532> kai with Πρίσκιλλαν <WG4252> Priskillan Priscilla γυναῖκα <WG1135> gynaika wife αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his διὰ <WG1223> dia because τὸ <WG3588> to - διατεταχέναι <WG1299> diatetachenai had ordered Κλαύδιον <WG2804> Klaudion Claudius χωρίζεσθαι <WG5563> chōrizesthai to leave πάντας <WG3956> pantas all τοὺς <WG3588> tous the Ἰουδαίους <WG2453> Ioudaious Jews ἀπὸ <WG575> apo . . . τῆς <WG3588> tēs - Ῥώμης <WG4516> Rhōmēs Rome . προσῆλθεν <WG4334> prosēlthen [Paul] went αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois to [ visit ] them ,

καὶ <WG2532> kai and διὰ <WG1223> dia because τὸ <WG3588> to - ὁμότεχνον <WG3673> homotechnon [just as] εἶναι <WG1510> einai he was . ἔμενεν <WG3306> emenen he stayed παρ’ <WG3844> par’ with αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois them καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἠργάζετο* <WG2038> ērgazeto worked ἦσαν <WG1510> ēsan they were γὰρ <WG1063> gar - σκηνοποιοὶ <WG4635> skēnopoioi tentmakers τῇ <WG3588> tē vvv τέχνῃ <WG5078> technē by trade ,

Διελέγετο <WG1256> Dielegeto he reasoned δὲ <WG1161> de - ἐν <WG1722> en in τῇ <WG3588> tē the συναγωγῇ <WG4864> synagōgē synagogue , κατὰ <WG2596> kata - πᾶν <WG3956> pan Every σάββατον <WG4521> sabbaton Sabbath ἔπειθέν <WG3982> epeithen trying to persuade τε <WG5037> te alike . Ἰουδαίους <WG2453> Ioudaious Jews καὶ <WG2532> kai and Ἕλληνας <WG1672> Hellēnas Greeks

Ὡς <WG5613> Hōs when δὲ <WG1161> de And κατῆλθον <WG2718> katēlthon came down ἀπὸ <WG575> apo from τῆς <WG3588> tēs - Μακεδονίας <WG3109> Makedonias Macedonia , ὅ <WG3588> ho - τε <WG5037> te - Σιλᾶς <WG4609> Silas Silas καὶ <WG2532> kai and ὁ <WG3588> ho - Τιμόθεος <WG5095> Timotheos Timothy συνείχετο <WG4912> syneicheto devoted himself fully τῷ <WG3588> tō to the λόγῳ <WG3056> logō word , ὁ <WG3588> ho - Παῦλος <WG3972> Paulos Paul διαμαρτυρόμενος <WG1263> diamartyromenos testifying τοῖς <WG3588> tois to the Ἰουδαίοις <WG2453> Ioudaiois Jews εἶναι <WG1510> einai is τὸν <WG3588> ton the Χριστὸν <WG5547> Christon Christ . Ἰησοῦν <WG2424> Iēsoun [that] Jesus

ἀντιτασσομένων <WG498> antitassomenōn opposed δὲ <WG1161> de But [when] αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn they καὶ <WG2532> kai and βλασφημούντων <WG987> blasphēmountōn insulted [him] , ἐκτιναξάμενος <WG1621> ektinaxamenos he shook out τὰ <WG3588> ta [his] ἱμάτια <WG2440> himatia garments εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen [and] told πρὸς <WG4314> pros . . . αὐτούς <WG846> autous them , Τὸ <WG3588> To - αἷμα <WG129> haima blood ὑμῶν <WG4771> hymōn “ Your ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi [be] on τὴν <WG3588> tēn [own] κεφαλὴν <WG2776> kephalēn heads ! ὑμῶν <WG4771> hymōn your καθαρὸς <WG2513> katharos innocent [of it] . ἐγώ <WG1473> egō I [am] ἀπὸ <WG575> apo From τοῦ <WG3588> tou - νῦν <WG3568> nyn now on εἰς <WG1519> eis to τὰ <WG3588> ta the ἔθνη <WG1484> ethnē Gentiles . ” πορεύσομαι <WG4198> poreusomai I will go

Καὶ <WG2532> Kai [So] μεταβὰς <WG3327> metabas [Paul] left ἐκεῖθεν <WG1564> ekeithen . . . εἰσῆλθεν* <WG1525> eisēlthen [and] went εἰς <WG1519> eis to οἰκίαν <WG3614> oikian [the] house τινὸς <WG5100> tinos of ὀνόματι <WG3686> onomati - [[Τίτου]] <WG5103> Titou Titus Ἰούστου <WG2459> Ioustou Justus , ( ECM; NA, SBL, NE, and WH Titius Justus; BYZ and TR Justus) σεβομένου <WG4576> sebomenou a worshiper τὸν <WG3588> ton - Θεόν <WG2316> Theon of God . οὗ <WG3739> hou - ἡ <WG3588> hē - οἰκία <WG3614> oikia - ἦν <WG1510> ēn - συνομοροῦσα <WG4927> synomorousa next door τῇ <WG3588> tē the συναγωγῇ <WG4864> synagōgē synagogue

Κρίσπος <WG2921> Krispos Crispus , δὲ <WG1161> de - ὁ <WG3588> ho the ἀρχισυνάγωγος <WG752> archisynagōgos synagogue leader , ἐπίστευσεν <WG4100> episteusen believed τῷ <WG3588> tō in the Κυρίῳ <WG2962> Kyriō Lord . σὺν <WG4862> syn and ὅλῳ <WG3650> holō whole τῷ <WG3588> tō - οἴκῳ <WG3624> oikō household αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his καὶ <WG2532> kai And πολλοὶ <WG4183> polloi many τῶν <WG3588> tōn of the Κορινθίων <WG2881> Korinthiōn Corinthians ἀκούοντες <WG191> akouontes who heard [ the message ] ἐπίστευον <WG4100> episteuon believed καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐβαπτίζοντο <WG907> ebaptizonto were baptized .

Εἶπεν <WG2036> Eipen spoke δὲ <WG1161> de One ὁ <WG3588> ho the Κύριος <WG2962> Kyrios Lord ἐν <WG1722> en . . . νυκτὶ <WG3571> nykti night δι’ <WG1223> di’ in ὁράματος <WG3705> horamatos a vision : τῷ <WG3588> tō - Παύλῳ <WG3972> Paulō to Paul Μὴ <WG3361> Mē “ Do not φοβοῦ <WG5399> phobou be afraid ; ἀλλὰ <WG235> alla - λάλει <WG2980> lalei keep on speaking ; καὶ <WG2532> kai - μὴ <WG3361> mē do not σιωπήσῃς <WG4623> siōpēsēs be silent .

διότι <WG1360> dioti For ἐγώ <WG1473> egō I εἰμι <WG1510> eimi am μετὰ <WG3326> meta with σοῦ <WG4771> sou you καὶ <WG2532> kai and οὐδεὶς <WG3762> oudeis no one ἐπιθήσεταί <WG2007> epithēsetai will lay a hand on σοι <WG4771> soi . . . τοῦ <WG3588> tou . . . κακῶσαί <WG2559> kakōsai . . . σε <WG4771> se you , διότι <WG1360> dioti because λαός <WG2992> laos people ἐστί <WG1510> esti I have μοι <WG1473> moi . . . πολὺς <WG4183> polys many ἐν <WG1722> en in τῇ <WG3588> tē - πόλει <WG4172> polei city . ” ταύτῃ <WG3778> tautē this

Ἐκάθισεν <WG2523> Ekathisen [Paul] stayed δὲ <WG1161> de [So] ἐνιαυτὸν <WG1763> eniauton for a year καὶ <WG2532> kai and μῆνας <WG3376> mēnas . . . , ἓξ <WG1803> hex [a half] διδάσκων <WG1321> didaskōn teaching ἐν <WG1722> en among αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois [the Corinthians] . τὸν <WG3588> ton the λόγον <WG3056> logon word τοῦ <WG3588> tou - Θεοῦ <WG2316> Theou of God

Γαλλίωνος <WG1058> Galliōnos Gallio ( Paul before Gallio) δὲ <WG1161> de [While] ἀνθυπάτου <WG446> anthypatou proconsul ὄντος <WG1510> ontos was τῆς <WG3588> tēs of Ἀχαΐας <WG882> Achaias Achaia , κατεπέστησαν <WG2721> katepestēsan attack ὁμοθυμαδὸν <WG3661> homothymadon coordinated an οἱ <WG3588> hoi the Ἰουδαῖοι <WG2453> Ioudaioi Jews τῷ <WG3588> tō - Παύλῳ <WG3972> Paulō on Paul καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἤγαγον <WG71> ēgagon brought αὐτὸν <WG846> auton him ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi before τὸ <WG3588> to the βῆμα <WG968> bēma judgment seat .

λέγοντες <WG3004> legontes they said ὅτι <WG3754> hoti - . Παρὰ <WG3844> Para in ways contrary to τὸν <WG3588> ton the νόμον <WG3551> nomon law , ” ἀναπείθει <WG374> anapeithei is persuading οὗτος <WG3778> houtos “ This [man] τοὺς <WG3588> tous the ἀνθρώπους <WG444> anthrōpous [people] σέβεσθαι <WG4576> sebesthai to worship τὸν <WG3588> ton - Θεόν <WG2316> Theon God

Μέλλοντος <WG3195> Mellontos was about δὲ <WG1161> de But [just as] τοῦ <WG3588> tou - Παύλου <WG3972> Paulou Paul ἀνοίγειν <WG455> anoigein to speak τὸ <WG3588> to . . . στόμα <WG4750> stoma . . . , εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen told ὁ <WG3588> ho - Γαλλίων <WG1058> Galliōn Gallio πρὸς <WG4314> pros . . . τοὺς <WG3588> tous the Ἰουδαίους <WG2453> Ioudaious Jews , Εἰ <WG1487> Ei “ If μὲν <WG3303> men - ἦν <WG1510> ēn this matter involved ἀδίκημά <WG92> adikēma wrongdoing τι <WG5100> ti a ἢ <WG2228> ē or ῥᾳδιούργημα <WG4467> rhadiourgēma crime , πονηρόν <WG4190> ponēron vicious ὦ <WG5599> ō O Ἰουδαῖοι <WG2453> Ioudaioi Jews , κατὰ <WG2596> kata vvv λόγον <WG3056> logon it would be reasonable ἂν <WG302> an vvv ἀνεσχόμην <WG430> aneschomēn for me to hear ὑμῶν <WG4771> hymōn your [ complaint ] .

εἰ <WG1487> ei since δὲ <WG1161> de But ζητήματά <WG2213> zētēmata a dispute ἐστιν <WG1510> estin it is περὶ <WG4012> peri about λόγου <WG3056> logou words καὶ <WG2532> kai and ὀνομάτων <WG3686> onomatōn names καὶ <WG2532> kai and νόμου <WG3551> nomou law , τοῦ <WG3588> tou vvv καθ’ <WG2596> kath’ vvv ὑμᾶς <WG4771> hymas your own ὄψεσθε <WG3708> opsesthe settle [it] αὐτοί <WG846> autoi yourselves . κριτὴς <WG2923> kritēs a judge ἐγὼ <WG1473> egō I τούτων <WG3778> toutōn of such things . ” οὐ <WG3756> ou . . . βούλομαι <WG1014> boulomai refuse εἶναι <WG1510> einai to be
καὶ <WG2532> kai And ἀπήλασεν <WG556> apēlasen he drove αὐτοὺς <WG846> autous them away ἀπὸ <WG575> apo from τοῦ <WG3588> tou the βήματος <WG968> bēmatos judgment seat .

Ἐπιλαβόμενοι <WG1949> Epilabomenoi seized δὲ <WG1161> de At this , πάντες <WG3956> pantes the crowd ( Literally they all; BYZ and TR all the Greeks) Σωσθένην <WG4988> Sōsthenēn Sosthenes τὸν <WG3588> ton the ἀρχισυνάγωγον <WG752> archisynagōgon synagogue leader ἔτυπτον <WG5180> etypton [and] beat [him] ἔμπροσθεν <WG1715> emprosthen in front of τοῦ <WG3588> tou the βήματος <WG968> bēmatos judgment seat . καὶ <WG2532> kai [But] οὐδὲν <WG3762> ouden none τούτων <WG3778> toutōn of this τῷ <WG3588> tō - Γαλλίωνι <WG1058> Galliōni to Gallio . ἔμελεν <WG3199> emelen was of concern

Ὁ <WG3588> Ho - ( Paul Returns to Antioch) δὲ <WG1161> de - Παῦλος <WG3972> Paulos Paul ἔτι <WG2089> eti some προσμείνας <WG4357> prosmeinas remained [in Corinth] ἡμέρας <WG2250> hēmeras time ἱκανὰς <WG2425> hikanas for quite τοῖς <WG3588> tois to the ἀδελφοῖς <WG80> adelphois brothers . ἀποταξάμενος <WG657> apotaxamenos [before] saying goodbye ἐξέπλει <WG1602> exeplei [and then] he sailed εἰς <WG1519> eis for τὴν <WG3588> tēn - Συρίαν <WG4947> Syrian Syria , καὶ <WG2532> kai vvv σὺν <WG4862> syn accompanied by αὐτῷ <WG846> autō - Πρίσκιλλα <WG4252> Priskilla Priscilla καὶ <WG2532> kai and Ἀκύλας <WG207> Akylas Aquila . κειράμενος <WG2751> keiramenos shaved ἐν <WG1722> en in Κενχρεαῖς <WG2747> Kenchreais Cenchrea τὴν <WG3588> tēn He had [his] κεφαλήν <WG2776> kephalēn head εἶχεν <WG2192> eichen he had [ made ] , γὰρ <WG1063> gar to keep εὐχήν <WG2171> euchēn a vow

Κατήντησαν <WG2658> Katēntēsan they reached δὲ <WG1161> de [When] εἰς <WG1519> eis . . . Ἔφεσον <WG2181> Epheson Ephesus , κἀκείνους <WG2548> kakeinous [Priscilla and Aquila] . κατέλιπεν <WG2641> katelipen [Paul] parted ways with αὐτοῦ <WG847> autou . . . αὐτὸς <WG846> autos He himself δὲ <WG1161> de - εἰσελθὼν <WG1525> eiselthōn went εἰς <WG1519> eis into τὴν <WG3588> tēn the συναγωγὴν <WG4864> synagōgēn synagogue [there] διελέξατο <WG1256> dielexato [and] reasoned τοῖς <WG3588> tois with the Ἰουδαίοις <WG2453> Ioudaiois Jews .

ἐρωτώντων <WG2065> erōtōntōn asked [him] δὲ <WG1161> de [When] αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn they ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi for πλείονα <WG4119> pleiona a while longer χρόνον <WG5550> chronon . . . , μεῖναι <WG3306> meinai to stay οὐκ <WG3756> ouk vvv ἐπένευσεν <WG1962> epeneusen he declined .

ἀλλὰ <WG235> alla But ἀποταξάμενος <WG657> apotaxamenos as he left , καὶ <WG2532> kai - εἰπών <WG2036> eipōn he said , Πάλιν <WG3825> Palin “ vvv ἀνακάμψω <WG344> anakampsō I will come back ( BYZ and TR I must by all means keep this feast that comes in Jerusalem, but I will come back) πρὸς <WG4314> pros to ὑμᾶς <WG4771> hymas you τοῦ <WG3588> tou - Θεοῦ <WG2316> Theou [if] God θέλοντος <WG2309> thelontos is willing . ” ἀνήχθη <WG321> anēchthē [And] he set sail ἀπὸ <WG575> apo from τῆς <WG3588> tēs - Ἐφέσου <WG2181> Ephesou Ephesus .

καὶ <WG2532> kai [When Paul] κατελθὼν <WG2718> katelthōn had landed εἰς <WG1519> eis at Καισάρειαν <WG2542> Kaisareian Caesarea , ἀναβὰς <WG305> anabas he went up καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἀσπασάμενος <WG782> aspasamenos greeted τὴν <WG3588> tēn the ἐκκλησίαν <WG1577> ekklēsian church [ at Jerusalem ] . ( Literally he went up and greeted the church) κατέβη <WG2597> katebē [Then] he went down εἰς <WG1519> eis to Ἀντιόχειαν <WG490> Antiocheian Antioch .

( Paul’s Third Missionary Journey Begins) ( ( 510 13:1-3 ; 510 15:36-41 )) Καὶ <WG2532> Kai [After] ποιήσας <WG4160> poiēsas [Paul] had spent χρόνον <WG5550> chronon time [in Antioch] , τινὰ <WG5100> tina some ἐξῆλθεν <WG1831> exēlthen he traveled διερχόμενος <WG1330> dierchomenos throughout καθεξῆς <WG2517> kathexēs from place to place τὴν <WG3588> tēn the Γαλατικὴν <WG1054> Galatikēn of Galatia χώραν <WG5561> chōran region καὶ <WG2532> kai and Φρυγίαν <WG5435> Phrygian Phrygia , στηρίζων <WG1991> stērizōn strengthening πάντας <WG3956> pantas all τοὺς <WG3588> tous the μαθητάς <WG3101> mathētas disciples .

Ἰουδαῖος <WG2453> Ioudaios Jew δέ <WG1161> de Meanwhile τις <WG5100> tis a Ἀπολλῶς <WG625> Apollōs Apollos , ὀνόματι <WG3686> onomati named Ἀλεξανδρεὺς <WG221> Alexandreus of Alexandria , τῷ <WG3588> tō - γένει <WG1085> genei a native ἀνὴρ <WG435> anēr man , λόγιος <WG3052> logios an eloquent κατήντησεν <WG2658> katēntēsen came εἰς <WG1519> eis to Ἔφεσον <WG2181> Epheson Ephesus . δυνατὸς <WG1415> dynatos well versed ὢν <WG1510> ōn He was ἐν <WG1722> en in ταῖς <WG3588> tais the γραφαῖς <WG1124> graphais Scriptures .

οὗτος <WG3778> houtos He ἦν <WG1510> ēn had been κατηχημένος <WG2727> katēchēmenos instructed in τὴν <WG3588> tēn the ὁδὸν <WG3598> hodon way τοῦ <WG3588> tou of the Κυρίου <WG2962> Kyriou Lord καὶ <WG2532> kai and ζέων <WG2204> zeōn was fervent τῷ <WG3588> tō - πνεύματι <WG4151> pneumati in spirit . ἐλάλει <WG2980> elalei He spoke καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐδίδασκεν <WG1321> edidasken taught ἀκριβῶς <WG199> akribōs accurately τὰ <WG3588> ta - περὶ <WG4012> peri about τοῦ <WG3588> tou - Ἰησοῦ <WG2424> Iēsou Jesus , ( BYZ and TR about the Lord) ἐπιστάμενος <WG1987> epistamenos [though] he knew μόνον <WG3440> monon only τὸ <WG3588> to the βάπτισμα <WG908> baptisma baptism Ἰωάννου <WG2491> Iōannou of John .

οὗτός <WG3778> houtos he τε <WG5037> te And ἤρξατο <WG756> ērxato began παρρησιάζεσθαι <WG3955> parrēsiazesthai to speak boldly ἐν <WG1722> en in τῇ <WG3588> tē the συναγωγῇ <WG4864> synagōgē synagogue . ἀκούσαντες <WG191> akousantes heard δὲ <WG1161> de [When] αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou him , Πρίσκιλλα <WG4252> Priskilla Priscilla καὶ <WG2532> kai and Ἀκύλας <WG207> Akylas Aquila προσελάβοντο <WG4355> proselabonto they took him in αὐτὸν <WG846> auton . . . καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἀκριβέστερον <WG199> akribesteron more accurately . αὐτῷ <WG846> autō to him ἐξέθεντο <WG1620> exethento explained τὴν <WG3588> tēn the ὁδὸν <WG3598> hodon way τοῦ <WG3588> tou of Θεοῦ <WG2316> Theou God

Βουλομένου <WG1014> Boulomenou resolved δὲ <WG1161> de [When] αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou [Apollos] διελθεῖν <WG1330> dielthein to cross over εἰς <WG1519> eis to τὴν <WG3588> tēn - Ἀχαΐαν <WG882> Achaian Achaia , προτρεψάμενοι <WG4389> protrepsamenoi encouraged [him] οἱ <WG3588> hoi the ἀδελφοὶ <WG80> adelphoi brothers ἔγραψαν <WG1125> egrapsan [and] wrote τοῖς <WG3588> tois to the μαθηταῖς <WG3101> mathētais disciples [there] ἀποδέξασθαι <WG588> apodexasthai to welcome αὐτόν <WG846> auton him . ὃς <WG3739> hos . . . , παραγενόμενος <WG3854> paragenomenos On his arrival συνεβάλετο <WG4820> synebaleto help πολὺ <WG4183> poly he was a great τοῖς <WG3588> tois to those who πεπιστευκόσιν <WG4100> pepisteukosin had believed . διὰ <WG1223> dia by τῆς <WG3588> tēs - χάριτος <WG5485> charitos grace

εὐτόνως <WG2159> eutonōs he powerfully γὰρ <WG1063> gar For τοῖς <WG3588> tois the Ἰουδαίοις <WG2453> Ioudaiois Jews διακατηλέγχετο <WG1246> diakatēlencheto refuted δημοσίᾳ <WG1219> dēmosia in public [debate] , ἐπιδεικνὺς <WG1925> epideiknys proving διὰ <WG1223> dia from τῶν <WG3588> tōn the γραφῶν <WG1124> graphōn Scriptures εἶναι <WG1510> einai is τὸν <WG3588> ton the Χριστὸν <WG5547> Christon Christ . Ἰησοῦν <WG2424> Iēsoun [that] Jesus
